intro: Siphotoxis, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features striking yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disc of smaller florets. Siphotoxis typically grows in open, sunny habitats and is often found in grasslands or rocky areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
